result.execSummary:
The defendant Brieanna M. Persike was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: S.Y.- to be paid at the rate of no less than $70.00 per month and to begin June 2015.
FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time defendant does not meet that condition, then she must perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with victims S.Y., J.G., & A.W.

Any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Defendant entitled to 18 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 
PLEA: 
17CM1104:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
17CM1104:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: 20 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or combination to be served consecutive to 15CF13 and Concurrent to Ct. 2 in 17CM1104, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Restitution in the amount of $67.45 to be paid to Family Dollar, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample.

Ct. 2 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: 20 Days MCJ to be served consecutive to 15CF13 and Concurrent to Ct. 1 in 17CM1104, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Restitution in the amount of $67.45 to be paid to Family Dollar, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample.

15CF13:
Ct. 2 (Theft-Movable Property)>> 9 Months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or combination. Court finds 144 Days Credit. Any outstanding financial obligations and restitution outstanding is to be converted to a civil judgment. Defendant's treatment days are to be applied as credit days towards sentence.
